meanings.definition: The occupants of a tenement or rented property.
meanings.sent1: The tenantry in the apartment building were friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The tenantry paid their rent on time each month.
meanings.sent3: The tenantry organized a potluck dinner to get to know each other better.
meanings.sent4: The tenantry formed a strong bond like a family living under one roof.
meanings.sent5: The tenantry included people from various backgrounds and professions.

meanings.definition: The system or practice of renting land or property to tenants.
meanings.sent1: The tenantry of the farmland helped support the local economy.
meanings.sent2: The landlord explained the terms of the tenantry agreement to the new tenants.
meanings.sent3: The tenantry system made it easy for people to find affordable housing.
meanings.sent4: The tenantry arrangement allowed for a fair distribution of resources.
meanings.sent5: The tenantry process involved signing a lease and paying a security deposit.

meanings.definition: The collective body of tenants on a particular estate or property.
meanings.sent1: The tenantry gathered for a meeting to discuss maintenance issues.
meanings.sent2: The landlord addressed the concerns of the tenantry during the town hall.
meanings.sent3: The tenantry celebrated a successful year with a barbecue party.
meanings.sent4: The tenantry worked together to improve the community garden.
meanings.sent5: The tenantry shared a sense of responsibility for the upkeep of the building.
